post.body: Hello ZeroMe! First time exploring ZeroNet.

I see that [ZeroBlog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/) hasn't been updated since last year, but development is still going on github. Is there a blog or feed to follow for development progress and releases of ZeroNet?
How do I find a list of other hubs to connect to for ZeroMe? Do I need to do this to see users who post on other hubs?

The [Briar Project](https://briarproject.org/) is [hiring for a project manager ,developer and QA tester](https://briarproject.org/hiring/). Briar is a peer to peer encrypted messenger for Android devices.

If you run a bitcoin lightning node using `lnd` with a version less than 0.11.x, there's a [vulnerability that's been announced](https://groups.google.com/a/lightning.engineering/g/lnd/c/NtG33wYrHdo/m/fWam0XbLAQAJ?pli=1) that requires an upgrade.

```
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA256

Hi all,

We are writing to let the Lightning community know about the existence of
vulnerabilities that affect lnd versions 0.10.x and below. The full details of
these vulnerabilities will be disclosed on October 20, 2020. The circumstances
surrounding the discovery resulted in a compressed disclosure timeline compared
to our usual timeframes. We will be publishing more details about this in the
coming weeks along with a comprehensive bug bounty program.

While we have no reason to believe these vulnerabilities have been exploited in
the wild, we strongly urge the community to upgrade to lnd 0.11.0 or above ASAP.
Please ping us on the #lnd IRC channel, the LND Slack, or at
sup...@lightning.engineering if you need any assistance in doing so. Upgrade
instructions can be found in our installation docs:
https://github.com/lightningnetwork/lnd/blob/master/docs/INSTALL.md#installing-lnd.

Regards,
Conner Fromknecht
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----

iQIzBAEBCAAdFiEEnI1hhop8SSADsnRO59c3tn+lkscFAl9/ozwACgkQ59c3tn+l
```

[Strand](http://127.0.0.1:43110/strandlang.bit/) is an interesting programming language. It is a concurrent logic programming language - a parallel variant of Prolog.

Each statement is automatically executed on a new thread and synchronization occurs through logic variables. For example:

```
main :- writeln('hello world!'),
        writeln(X),
        getcwd(X),
        C := foo(1,D),
        writeln(C),
        D := 'hello'.
```

When `main` is called, threads are spawned immediately to run each line in the body of the function. Notice that `writeln(X)` is lexically called before `getcwd(X)`. In the `writeln` the logic variable `X` is unbound so the thread blocks. When the thread running `getcwd(X)` finishes it binds `X` to the value of the current working directory. Now that `X` is bound, then the `writeln` thread unblocks and continues, writing the value of `X` to standard output.

The implementation linked from the [Strand](http://127.0.0.1:43110/strandlang.bit/) site mirror is written in forth and includes the ability to have distributed Strand nodes across machines.
I created a site for [C++ reference documentation](http://127.0.0.1:43110/156wJPKFTsNHfkLVzgFbJGQorzXATsV3wQ/), using the offline archive linked from cppreference.com.

US Government statement ([external link](https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/international-statement-end-end-encryption-and-public-safety)) on strong end to end encryption, with other countries signing on. I had posted a screenshot of it but the image was scaled beyond readability on ZeroMe.

comment.body: What sort of website? If you want a blog, clone "ZeroBlog" using the three vertical "..." to the right of the Zero Blog site entry on the left hand side of the interface. For an empty site, choose "Create new, Empty Site" from the three vertical dots at the top left next to "Hello ZeroNet_".
Large images don't display well in ZeroMe. Is there a way to open it full size or does it get scaled on uploading?

@Ansho Rei: Definitely agree with you. The argument that it will be used to stop "bad people" doesn't work either since they'll just switch to encryption that isn't broken. They're already engaging in criminal activity, if unbreakable encryption is illegal why would they care?
